occurrences.text: what our duty is, to preach Jesus. Amen? To lift him up, to preach Christ, to exalt our Savior. He's a wonderful Savior, and we find here that Philip is going to begin at that same scripture, and he's going to show this eunuch how that Jesus was the promised Messiah, and that Jesus, that he came to this earth, that he was born of a virgin, that he is the very Son of God. You think about the prophecies of Isaiah 7 and the prophecy of Isaiah 9. I'm not sure how much of the book of Isaiah Philip used. Again, we don't have the entirety of the message, but I'm sure that as he's preaching Jesus to this eunuch, that he's using the Word of God, and even as the scriptures would later tell us of the Apostle Paul, that Paul would go into those synagogues, and what would he do? He would preach to them that this Jesus whom I preach unto you is Christ, that he is the Messiah, he is the promised one, he is God in flesh. We find he's preaching Jesus. What a blessing. It's ours still today, 2,000 years later, it's still our call to preach Jesus, to preach Jesus, to lift him up. See, why? Because there's some people that don't know. There's some people that say, how can I? Except some man should guide me. We find
